name: Cajun Ham Salad Sandwiches
author: Karen Barris Calabro
summary: A not-too-spicy deviled ham recipe that makes you wish you had more leftover spiral ham during the holidays! It can also be served as an appetizer or in finger sandwiches and is always popular on football Sundays.
ingredients: ¼  red onion, cut into large chunks
2 stalks celery, cut into large chunks
10 ounces baked ham, trimmed and cut into 1-inch chunks
directions: Combine pickles, onion, and celery in a food processor; pulse to a medium-fine consistency
Add ham; pulse into pieces about 1/4 inch in diameter
Stir ham mixture, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, and Cajun seasoning together in a bowl
Divide ham salad mixture over 4 slices of rye bread; lay 2 lettuce leaves over each
